com.thomsonreuters.upa.codec

Interface Date


  • public interface Date
    Represents bandwidth optimized date value containing month, day, and year information.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void blank()
      Sets all members in Date to 0.
      void clear()
      Sets all members in Date to 0.
      int copy(Date destDate)
      This method will perform a deep copy of this Object to destDate.
      int day()
      Represents the day of the month, where 0 indicates a blank entry.
      int day(int day)
      Represents the day of the month, where 0 indicates a blank entry.
      int decode(DecodeIterator iter)
      Decode date.
      int encode(EncodeIterator iter)
      Used to encode a date into a buffer.
      boolean equals(Date thatDate)
      Checks equality of two Date structures.
      boolean isBlank()
      Returns true if all members in Time are set to the values used to signify blank.
      boolean isValid()
      Verifies the contents of a populated Date object.

      Represents the month of the year, where 0 indicates a blank entry.

      Represents the month of the year, where 0 indicates a blank entry.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Converts Date to a String.
      int value(java.lang.String value)
      Converts string date from "DD MMM YYYY" (01 JUN 2003) or "MM/DD/YYYY" (6/1/2003) format to Date.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear()
        Sets all members in Date to 0. Because 0 represents a blank date value, this performs the same functionality as #blank().

      • copy

        int copy(Date destDate)
        This method will perform a deep copy of this Object to destDate.
        Parameters:
        destDate - the destination Data Object.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if the destDate is null.

      • blank

        void blank()
        Sets all members in Date to 0. Because 0 represents a blank date value, this performs the same functionality as #clear().

      • isBlank

        boolean isBlank()
        Returns true if all members in Time are set to the values used to signify blank. A blank Date contains day, month and year values of 0.
        Returns:
        true if Date is blank, false otherwise

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()
        Verifies the contents of a populated Date object. Determines whether the specified day is valid within the specified month (e.g., a day greater than 31 is considered invalid for any month). This method uses the year member to determine leap year validity of day numbers for February.
        Returns:
        true if Date is blank or valid, false otherwise

      • equals

        boolean equals(Date thatDate)
        Checks equality of two Date structures.
        Parameters:
        thatDate - the other date to compare to this one
        Returns:
        true if dates are equal, false otherwise

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Converts Date to a String. Returns a String as "DD MM YYYY".
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string representation of this Date

      • value

        int value(java.lang.String value)
        Converts string date from "DD MMM YYYY" (01 JUN 2003) or "MM/DD/YYYY" (6/1/2003) format to Date.
        Parameters:
        value - string containing an appropriately formatted string to convert from
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if value is invalid.

      • encode

        int encode(EncodeIterator iter)
        Used to encode a date into a buffer.
        Parameters:
        iter - EncodeIterator with buffer to encode into. Iterator should also have appropriate version information set.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if success, CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE if failure, CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the encode buffer is too small
        See Also:
        EncodeIterator, CodecReturnCodes

      • decode

        int decode(DecodeIterator iter)
        Decode date.
        Parameters:
        iter - DecodeIterator with buffer to decode from and appropriate version information set.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if success, CodecReturnCodes.INCOMPLETE_DATA if failure, CodecReturnCodes.BLANK_DATA if data is blank value.
        See Also:
        DecodeIterator, CodecReturnCodes

      • day

        int day(int day)
        Represents the day of the month, where 0 indicates a blank entry. day allows for a range of 0 to 255, though the value typically does not exceed 31.
        Parameters:
        day - the day to set
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if day is invalid.

      • day

        int day()
        Represents the day of the month, where 0 indicates a blank entry. day allows for a range of 0 to 255, though the value typically does not exceed 31.
        Returns:
        the day

      • month

        int month(int month)
        Represents the month of the year, where 0 indicates a blank entry. month allows for a range of 0 to 255, though the value typically does not exceed 12.
        Parameters:
        month - the month to set
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if month is invalid.

      • month

        int month()
        Represents the month of the year, where 0 indicates a blank entry. month allows for a range of 0 to 255, though the value typically does not exceed 12.
        Returns:
        the month

      • year

        int year(int year)
        Represents the year, where 0 indicates a blank entry. You can use this member to specify a two or four digit year (where specific usage is indicated outside of UPA). year allows for a range of 0 to 65,535.
        Parameters:
        year - the year to set
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if year is invalid.

      • year

        int year()
        Represents the year, where 0 indicates a blank entry. You can use this member to specify a two or four digit year (where specific usage is indicated outside of UPA). year allows for a range of 0 to 65,535.
        Returns:
        the year
